main event: A bright, shiny, round object was observed exploding and breaking into two halves, with one half falling rapidly and the other falling more slowly, over Annapolis, Maryland on October 31, 1953.
interesting points: The object was observed by five civilian witnesses, including a newspaper distributor, his wife, a male neighbor, and the neighbor and his wife.
The witnesses were looking up to observe a flight of four F-245 aircraft when they saw the object above them.
The object was described as extremely bright and shiny, with a possible red cast, and had clearly defined edges.
The object exploded in a burst of white smoke and broke into two halves, with one half falling rapidly and the other falling more slowly before both faded from sight high in the air.
The sighting lasted for approximately 5 minutes.
sighted object: A bright, shiny, round object that exploded and broke into two halves
witnesses: Five civilian witnesses, including a newspaper distributor, his wife, a male neighbor, and the neighbor and his wife
